summary: Federal and academic studies have reported that millions of American adults with serious mental illnesses, such as schizophrenia and bipolar disorders, go untreated each year. This is driven, in part, by a national shortage of behavioral health care professionals. In recent years, states have increased use of peer support specialists—people who use their own experience recovering from mental illnesses to support others. We looked at...
title: Mental Health: Leading Practices for State Programs to Certify Peer Support Specialists
